title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 4 ยง 207.10 - Stenographic record and transcript
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 4 ยง 207.10 - Stenographic record and transcript

State Regulations
(a) Either party or the arbitrator may
request that a stenographic record of testimony be taken and that party shall
be responsible for arrangements for such stenographic record. (b) The party or parties requesting the
record shall pay the cost thereof, including the cost of a transcript to be
furnished to the arbitrator. If the arbitrator orders that testimony be
recorded, the cost of recording the testimony shall be mutually shared by the
parties, including the cost of a transcript to be furnished to the arbitrator. Any other party to the arbitration shall be entitled to obtain a transcript
upon payment therefor. The arbitrator shall indicate whether or not the
transcript taken shall serve as the official record of the
proceeding. Notes

New

York State Register August 2, 2017/Volume XXXIX, Issue 31, eff. 8/2/2017

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
